subject: Sleep
title: Sleep Tourism
description: A micro-lesson that makes Sleep Tourism usable.

hook.text: People now pay thousands of dollars to travel to luxury resorts for the sole purpose of sleeping better.

buildup.text: Sleep tourism emerged as hotels began offering sleep concierges, blackout suites, and custom pillow menus.

discovery.text: Luxury sleep retreats combine sleep coaching, circadian light therapy, and optimized sleep environments.

twist.text: The irony is that jet lag from traveling to these retreats often worsens sleep for the first several nights.

climax.text: Sleep tourism reveals how desperate modern humans are for rest they can't achieve in their daily lives.

punchline.text: We've gotten so bad at sleeping that we need a vacation to do it.

quiz.question: What does sleep tourism involve?
options: Traveling to luxury retreats designed to optimize sleep
Sleeping in airports during long layovers
